intro: Aeoniopsis, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and is native to South America. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Aeoniopsis species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, where they thrive with minimal water. Their botanical features make them interesting subjects for ecological and horticultural study.
